title: E6B Computations
notes: Use an E6B for all computations below. Answers may be less accurate than with a calculator, and may include a small amount of variation depending on how you read the E6B.

questions.question: You used 67L of fuel in 1h 13m. How much will you use in the next 25 minutes?
You've travelled 78nm in 44 minutes. How far will you travel in the next 9 minutes?
How does speed relate to distance and time?
On the E6B calculator side, time is always on the (inner/outer) scale, distance is always on the (inner/outer) scale.
In 24 minutes you travel 63nm. What is your speed?
You fly at 125kt for 41 minutes, how much distance do you cover?
To calculate ETA, add __________ to your __________.
Most US-built light aircraft have consumption figures and fuel gauge markings in __________. In New Zealand refuelling is done in __________.
An Imperial gallon is slightly (larger/smaller) than a US gallon.
How much fuel is consumed in 1h 20m at a consumption rate of 39 litres per hour?
If you use 19 litres of fuel in 32 minutes, what is your fuel consumption rate?
